title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 202.51 - Proof required in dissolution proceedings
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 202.51 - Proof required in dissolution proceedings

State Regulations

In all actions in which the accounts of a
receiver appointed in an action for the dissolution of a corporation are
presented for settlement or to be passed upon by the court, a notice or a copy
of an advertisement requiring the creditors to present their claims to a
referee must be mailed, with the postage thereon prepaid, to each creditor
whose name appears on the books of the corporation, at least 20 days before the
date specified in such notice or advertisement. Proof of such mailing shall be
required on the application for a final decree passing the accounts of the
receiver unless proof is furnished that personal service of such notice or copy
of advertisement has been made upon the creditors. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22
ยง
202.51

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
